long_desc.thetext:
Version-Release number of selected component (if applicable): dnf-1.1.10-4.fc24.noarch
Steps to Reproduce: 1. Install some debuginfo packages? I'm not sure about this step. I have the following installed: glibc-debuginfo-2.23.1-11.fc24.x86_64 systemd-debuginfo-229-18.fc24.x86_64 openssl-debuginfo-1.0.2k-1.fc24.x86_64 keyutils-debuginfo-1.5.9-8.fc24.x86_64 attr-debuginfo-2.4.47-16.fc24.x86_64 zlib-debuginfo-1.2.8-10.fc24.x86_64 gcc-debuginfo-6.3.1-1.fc24.x86_64 libselinux-debuginfo-2.5-12.fc24.x86_64 libidn-debuginfo-1.33-1.fc24.x86_64 krb5-debuginfo-1.14.4-4.fc24.x86_64 glibc-debuginfo-common-2.23.1-11.fc24.x86_64 libsepol-debuginfo-2.5-10.fc24.x86_64 iputils-debuginfo-20160308-3.fc24.x86_64 pcre-debuginfo-8.40-5.fc24.x86_64 libverto-debuginfo-0.2.6-6.fc24.x86_64 gcc-base-debuginfo-6.3.1-1.fc24.x86_64 nss-softokn-debuginfo-3.29.3-1.0.fc24.x86_64 e2fsprogs-debuginfo-1.42.13-4.fc24.x86_64 libcap-debuginfo-2.24-9.fc24.x86_64 2. # dnf update "*-debuginfo" 3. dnf eats 100% cpu now
Actual results: dnf eats 100% cpu
Expected results: dnf updates debuginfo packages which need to be updated

The problem was fixed in dnf-2.2.0-1 that was released into rawhide and fc26. We also provide a test repository for fc24 and later versions ("dnf copr enable rpmsoftwaremanagement/dnf-nightly"). Please if the problem appears with dnf-2.2 or later, please don't hesitate to reopen the bug report.
